intro: Leontodon laciniatus, commonly known as the cut-leaved hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and rocky soils, and it produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of disk flowers. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leontodon laciniatus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
